review_title: New, energetic, compassionate, and smart leadership team rising
pros: Some Pros: Good workplace values, culture, and mission. Salaries and pay rates for all have been increasing dramatically over the past year. Bonita House staff benefits are VERY solid (100% paid employee Kaiser anyone (not dependents, but still ...)? You get to work with smart, dedicated social services and behavioral healthcare peoples. Lots of fresh faces with positive energy. You love to see it. The workplace culture also is laser focused on employee hiring and retention, no easy task in the modern economy. Great strides are being made to hire the right employees, to keep them happy, and to increase training opportunities. Substantial efforts being made (with some successes) with new contracts for services with local governments.
cons: Some Cons: enduring some of the major leadership and management shifts over the past few years has been very challenging (thankfully, this is no longer the case). Sometimes parking can be a bit challenging at certain locations. The electronic health records (EHR) system for entering notes is clunky and sometimes frustrating but ongoing efforts to improve are making measurable headway. Bonita House has multiple, separate programs and 5 locations, so at times it is challenging for messaging and collaboration, although this is slowly changing for the good.

pros: As a later life career change, I have working with several organizations throughout the mental health field and outside. Being part of a team that is so dedicated to the community and feeling like the words I say matter, even if the organization is unable to run with them. My ideas are listened to and I do not feel dismissed. I love my job and the freedom of not being micro-managed. Each individual in the organization that I have met and encountered  is dedicated to the mission and most of all the clients. We all share the same passion of people and the community. I have not met a better direct staff.
cons: With some growing pains. The end vision is incredible.   I am honored to be part of this organization as it grows at this time. Communication doesn't always get from the top to the bottom effectively, I like to think that the management is aware and is providing additional support to middle management.  I think it is being addressed. As all teams have a curve to form storm and norm, it is temporary (I feel). Nonetheless, current process that may not be easy for all.

review_title: Very proud to be part of this agency!
pros: Been here for more than 2 years and this agency really is a great place to be. Management and Exec team are very supportive and transparent.   A lot of us a very grateful that during this COVID19 pandemic that the agency takes care of its staff by allowing majority of us to work from home.  This is such a HUGE help as I and some of my colleageas say to each other that the agency really has the best interest of its staff at heart.
cons: I wish some staff who are not happy can just keep comments to themselves and not be toxic.  If you can't meet productivity which affects the team and inspite of all the support given our way, pls just be a teamplayer and do your part.

pros:
Supportive and fun work environment. Open minded, holistic treatment, strengths based framework for client work. Team oriented, consensus focused. 
Lots of face to face client work, not stuck behind a desk. No medi-cal billing requirements! Minimal documentation required.
Great for creative, outside the box thinkers and problem solvers.
Comprehensive benefit package. Lots of PTO. Encouraged to take time off.
cons:
Salary is not competitive and on the low end for the qualifications they require. 
Employee retention is tough for full and part time staff, so full time staff is often filling in when someone calls out sick or we haven't been able to fill a position quickly. 
Highly structured schedule for counselors. No flexible time.  Every hour of your day is allotted for specific tasks (running groups, helping with meals, therapy sessions etc)
